result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L. Salzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA Assessment and/or follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Absolute sobriety and random urine screens IF deemed appropriate by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L. Salzman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michelle L. Salzman in court.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states she wishes to proceed today pro se.  Court performs colloquy with Defendant regarding her right to an attorney.  Defendant again states she wishes to proceed pro se and wavies her right to counsel.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  6 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ;  IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY AGENT
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

COSTS:  $343.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 3, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michelle L. Salzman in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states she wishes to proceed pro se.  Court sets case for jury status and jury trial.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michelle L. Salzman in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant to see public defender.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the witness.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Michelle L. Salzman in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
